cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi WSW of St. Petersburg, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then turning NNE/NE across the northern Florida peninsula and southeast Georgia toward the Atlantic off the South Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of Cedar Key, on Florida’s northern Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch north of the Suwannee River to Aucilla River, FL (Gulf coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Bonita Beach to Suwannee River, FL; Storm Surge Warning Bonita Beach to Suwannee River, FL including Tampa Bay and Charlotte Harbor
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, the northern Florida peninsula, southeast Georgia, and the coastal Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤ 9% chance) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 kt possible late Thu–early Fri
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation 1–2 ft possible along the Georgia barrier islands during onshore flow Thu night
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rainfall with isolated 3 inch totals possible Thu–Fri
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes possible in rainbands; elevated rip-current risk
